title: Usernames ending in .json are not restricted

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
Desciption:
Username  in *.json   is not restricted.

disallowed *.json is allowed in username  restriction

URL   :  https://gratipay.com/robots.txt

User-agent: *
Disallow: /*.json
Disallow: /on/*

POC URL:
https://gratipay.com/~karthic.json/  and you will end up at my profile page.
vulnerability_information_html:
Desciption:
Username in *.json is not restricted.

disallowed *.json is allowed in username restriction

URL : https://gratipay.com/robots.txt

User-agent: *
Disallow: /.json
Disallow: /on/

POC URL:
https://gratipay.com/~karthic.json/ and you will end up at my profile page.

activities.message:
Hi @karthic,

Thanks for your report. However, I don't think this one present a valid security vulnerability.
The `robots.txt` file is here to tell the search engines to not index the files in `.json` and any URL starting by `/on/`—it's not related to our username restriction.

Do you see a reason to don't allow usernames in `.json`? `ride-free.json` and `lookup.json` are already disallowed.

Thanks for making Gratipay a safer place!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @karthic,

Thanks for your report. However, I don't think this one present a valid security vulnerability.
The robots.txt file is here to tell the search engines to not index the files in .json and any URL starting by /on/—it's not related to our username restriction.

Do you see a reason to don't allow usernames in .json? ride-free.json and lookup.json are already disallowed.

Thanks for making Gratipay a safer place!

activities.message:
@nashe_  
yes i agree with your points

one more bug

login to your gratipay account using google sign in  in google chrome browser

gratipay dashboard page is displayed 

then go to https://assets.gratipay.com/on/google/redirect in google chrome browser

Request URL:https://assets.gratipay.com/on/google/redirect
Request Method:POST
Status Code:500 Internal Server Error
Remote Address:192.168.35.243:8080
Response Headers
view source
Age:3
Cache-Control:no-cache
Content-Length:7595
Content-Type:text/html; charset=UTF-8
Date:Mon, 22 Aug 2016 12:59:23 GMT
Server:NetDNA-cache/2.2
Via:1.1 vegur, HTTPS/1.1 proxyr1.camsonline.com
X-Content-Type-Options:nosniff
X-Frame-Options:SAMEORIGIN
X-Gratipay-Version:1981
X-Xss-Protection:1; mode=block
Request Headers
view source

Accept-Language:en-US,en;q=0.8
Cache-Control:max-age=0
Connection:keep-alive
Content-Length:130
Content-Type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Host:assets.gratipay.com
Origin:https://assets.gratipay.com
Referer:https://assets.gratipay.com/gratipay.js?etag=%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=prompt(4)%3E
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests:1
User-Agent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/50.0.2661.94 Safari/537.36
Form Data
view source
view URL encoded
action:opt-in
then:L2Fzc2V0cy9ncmF0aXBheS5qcz9ldGFnPSUzQ2ltZyUyMHNyYz14JTIwb25lcnJvcj1wcm9tcHQoNCklM0U=
user_id:
csrf_token:None

fix : internal server error in https://assets.gratipay.com/on/google/redirect when we login using google sign in using gratipay account

activities.message:
I'm closing this report since we can't find any security implication nor a real issue in the username restriction.

Please open another report to discuss of this other behaviour. Note that it has already been reported and does not present any sign of security vulnerability. If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning. Thanks :-)
activities.markdown_message:
I'm closing this report since we can't find any security implication nor a real issue in the username restriction.

Please open another report to discuss of this other behaviour. Note that it has already been reported and does not present any sign of security vulnerability. If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning. Thanks :-)
